description: Triangle where n-th row is the first n terms of the sequence in reverse order, starting with a(1) = 1 and a(2) = 2.
comments: Lim f(f(...f(n))) where f(n) is fractal sequence in A004736.
references: C. Kimberling, "Numeration systems and fractal sequences," Acta Arithmetica 73 (1995) 103-117.
example: The triangle starts:12 11 2 11 1 2 12 1 1 2 11 2 1 1 2 1Since the sequence starts 1,2,1,1,2, row 5 is the reversal of that, 2,1,1,2,1.
prog: (PARI) at(n)=local(r,k);r=vector(n*(n+1)\2);r[1]=r[3]=1;r[2]=2;k=4;for(i=3,n,for(j=1,i,r[k]=r[i-j+1];k++));r /* Generates first n>1 rows of triangle. - Franklin T. Adams-Watters, Aug 08 2011. */
author: _Clark Kimberling_
